design_audit.ancova_control: baseline_outcome_mean (var_p3 = mean at last baseline season, fallback to pooled baseline)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Farmer investment in maize quality (expenses on seeds/fertilizer, input expenses, post-harvest handling practices and expenses)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Access to a market for quality maize (buy_treatment): village-level random assignment to an agro-trading company buying high-quality maize
claim_object.estimand_concept: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) average effect of market access assignment on investment outcomes
claim_object.target_population: Maize farming households in 20 experimental villages (sample frame 1) in Uganda, post-treatment seasons

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col1
baseline_specs.notes: Expenses on seeds and fertilizer; ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col2
baseline_specs.notes: Expenses on all inputs; ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col3
baseline_specs.notes: Proper drying dummy; ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col4
baseline_specs.notes: Sorting dummy; NO ANCOVA (post-harvest activity not measured at baseline)

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col5
baseline_specs.notes: Winnowing dummy; NO ANCOVA (post-harvest activity not measured at baseline)

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col6
baseline_specs.notes: Pre-harvest labor expenses; ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col7
baseline_specs.notes: Post-harvest expenses; ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table5-PanelA-Col8
baseline_specs.notes: Post-harvest labor expenses; ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

constraints.notes: Baseline uses ANCOVA (0-1 controls). Extended sets add pre-treatment household covariates. Max 6 = ANCOVA + 5 household chars.

rc_notes.rc/controls/loo/drop_ancova: REMOVED: redundant with rc/controls/sets/none for outcomes with ANCOVA, and a no-op for sort_d/winnow_d which have no ANCOVA control.
rc_notes.rc/form/outcome/asinh: Apply ONLY to continuous monetary outcomes (expenses_fert_seeds, expenses_inputs, expenses_labor_preharvest, expenses_postharvest, expenses_labor_postharvest). NOT to binary outcomes (tarpaulin_d, sort_d, winnow_d).
rc_notes.rc/form/outcome/log1p: Same restriction as asinh: continuous monetary outcomes only.
rc_notes.rc/sample/outliers/trim_y_1_99: Analyst-added for G1 (paper only trims Table 6 outcomes in Appendix Table 11). Apply only to continuous monetary outcomes, not binary.

canonical.notes: Clustered SE at the village level, matching the paper's baseline inference. Village is the randomization unit (20 villages: 12T, 8C).

variants.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust SE without clustering (stress test given only 20 clusters).
Fisher randomization inference with 10,000 permutations of village-level treatment assignment, matching the paper exactly. Seed 760130 from permutations.do for group 1.

budgets.notes: 8 baseline + 3 focal x (2 design + 2 controls + 4 sample + 2 form) = 8 + 30 = 38 for G1. Budget set at 64 to allow headroom. See spec_enumeration for precise breakdown.

sampling.notes: Full enumeration is feasible; no sampling needed.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Balance test for household characteristics and baseline outcomes (replicates Table 3).
Differential attrition test between treatment and control (replicates Appendix Table 6).

design_audit.ancova_control: baseline_outcome_mean (var_p3 = mean at last baseline season, fallback to pooled baseline)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Farmer productivity and income (price, acreage, harvest, yield, harvest value, expenses, profit monetary, profit including own hours)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Access to a market for quality maize (buy_treatment): village-level random assignment to an agro-trading company buying high-quality maize
claim_object.estimand_concept: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) average effect of market access assignment on productivity and income outcomes
claim_object.target_population: Maize farming households in 20 experimental villages (sample frame 1) in Uganda, post-treatment seasons

baseline_specs.label: Table6-PanelA-Col1
baseline_specs.notes: Price per kg (USD); ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table6-PanelA-Col2
baseline_specs.notes: Maize acreage; ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table6-PanelA-Col3
baseline_specs.notes: Harvest in kg; ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table6-PanelA-Col4
baseline_specs.notes: Yield (kg/acre); ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table6-PanelA-Col5
baseline_specs.notes: Harvest value (USD); ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table6-PanelA-Col6
baseline_specs.notes: Total monetary expenses (USD); ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table6-PanelA-Col7
baseline_specs.notes: Profit = harvest value - monetary expenses (USD); ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

baseline_specs.label: Table6-PanelA-Col8
baseline_specs.notes: Profit incl. own hours (USD); ANCOVA with baseline outcome mean

constraints.notes: Same as G1. ANCOVA (0-1 controls), extended adds pre-treatment household covariates.

rc_notes.rc/controls/loo/drop_ancova: REMOVED: redundant with rc/controls/sets/none. All G2 outcomes have ANCOVA, and dropping ANCOVA is the same as sets/none.
rc_notes.rc/form/outcome/asinh: Apply to continuous monetary/quantity outcomes (price, harvest_kg_tot, harvest_value, expenses, surplus, surplus_hrs). NOT to acreage or yield where level interpretation is natural.
rc_notes.rc/sample/outliers/trim_y_1_99: Replicates Appendix Table 11 exactly: non-negative continuous variables trimmed at top 1% per season; surplus/surplus_hrs trimmed at top and bottom 1% per season.

canonical.notes: Clustered SE at the village level, matching the paper's baseline inference. Village is the randomization unit (20 villages: 12T, 8C).

variants.notes: Fisher randomization inference with 10,000 permutations. Note: permutations.do uses seed 760130 for group 1 (same experiment for both G1 and G2).

budgets.notes: 8 baseline + 3 focal x (2 design + 2 controls + 4 sample + 2 form) = 8 + 30 = 38 for G2. Budget set at 64 to allow headroom.

sampling.notes: Full enumeration is feasible; no sampling needed.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Same balance test as G1 (same experiment, same sample).

focal_outcomes.G1_notes: Expenses on seeds and fertilizer is the first-listed investment outcome in Table 5, representing the core quality-upgrading investment channel.
focal_outcomes.G2_notes: Profit (monetary expenses) is the primary welfare outcome in Table 6 capturing net income effects.

available_covariates.notes: These 5 pre-treatment household characteristics are used in Table 3 balance tests. They are available as additional controls for the extended covariate set.

enumeration_plan.notes: For RC/design specs, we run 3 focal outcomes per group: expenses_fert_seeds, tarpaulin_d, expenses_postharvest for G1; surplus, harvest_value, yield for G2. Functional form transforms (asinh/log1p) run on 2 continuous monetary focal outcomes only (excluding binary tarpaulin_d for G1 and yield for G2). Trimming for G1 runs on 2 continuous monetary focal outcomes only (excluding binary tarpaulin_d). All time/panel sample specs run on all 3 focal outcomes.
